items.content:
*About Voltaware*

Voltaware is a dynamic London-based start-up at the forefront of energy monitoring and electricity usage itemisation.

We’re developing machine learning algorithms and building UX optimised interfaces to deliver real data insights to business and domestic users.


*The Team*

You’ll be joining an international team of entrepreneurs, engineers and designers with a history of successful application development and an enthusiasm for innovation and developing cutting edge applications.

We are looking for a self-driven individual capable of shaping and maintaining the key elements of excellent customer support. The successful candidate will join a new industry which is already beginning to occupy a vital role as society becomes ever more energy-conscious.

Join us for a journey instead of a job!


*Responsibilities*

* Understand and operate Voltaware’s Customer Support System
* Provide assistance with customer queries and for sales teams setting up accounts and configurations
* Ensure all incidents and requests are rapidly analysed and resolved in accordance to the contractual SLA
* GDPR and security awareness - ensuring rigorous adherence to these policies


*Requirements*

* Technology oriented
* Be proactive to make Customer Support effort more efficient
* Strong oral and written communication skills are essential!


*Preferred Experience*

* Previous Customer Support roles preferable
* Experience working with tech companies
* Have worked with international and remote teams
* Multilingual, French, or Italian



In addition to your CV, please submit the answer to the following question:

What excites you about working in a start-up?

items.title: Success Consultant
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
*Role Summary*

We’re looking for a passionate, customer-focused Success Consultant to join our growing team. Our primary route to market is through accounting and bookkeeping firms. You will be responsible for the delivery of Partner Success to those partner accounting and bookkeeping firms to ensure they make the most out of the block licences we sell to them. You will also be responsible for the delivery of Customer Success to new direct trialists to ensure maximum conversion from free trial. You will have responsibility for both ongoing retention and expansion MRR.

We are growing at a fantastic rate. Success and support are absolutely integral to our growth. This is an incredible opportunity for someone talented and ambitious to make a huge impact.

You'll be reporting directly to the Head of Success. Our head office is located in Moorgate London. Over half our team work remotely and we do offer remote working for the right candidate.

Your Role Will Consist Of

* Building a deep understanding of accounting and bookkeeping firms. You will need to develop a deep empathy that can enable us to work with them to successfully introduce Chaser to their clients
* Delivering and refining training programmes for accounting and bookkeeping firm staff. This training will need to provide them with a detailed understanding of how Chaser as a product works. It will also need to equip them to identify opportunities and successfully sell and market Chaser to clients who could benefit from it
* Ongoing partner and customer account management to both avoid churn and maximise upsell opportunities for growth in their use of Chaser
* Delivering demonstrations of Chaser
* Production educational resources about Chaser, including inter alia our help centre and educational videos
* Ensuring partners and customers are aware of all new developments to the product and enabled to make the most out of them
* Creating and running webinars about Chaser
* Delivering and refining our Customer Success outreach and training process to new direct trialists so as to maximise trial conversion and retention
* Ensuring that all customer and partner support is prompt and comprehensive. We pride ourselves on the quality of our support as a company
* Work closely with Sales, Marketing, Product and Engineering in carrying out these responsibilities; relaying feedback and insights as the voice of our partner and customer to shape our ongoing product roadmap
* Attending and representing Chaser at events

*About You*

* You will have a deep passion for helping our customers and partners succeed
* You will be a proactive self-starter who is comfortable taking the initiative and solving problems autonomously
* You will be positive with an ability to engender the energy and excitement in partners and customers to use Chaser
* You will be extremely ambitious
* You will love learning (fast!). You will be comfortable (well, as comfortable as it’s possible to be!) learning through trial and error
* You will have strong commercial and business acumen with an instinct for opportunity
* You don’t need to be an amateur netless tightrope walker, but you will be comfortable with the need to take risks in the role
* You will have excellent written communication skills
* You will have excellent spoken communication skills, both in person and over the phone. You will need to explain what are often complex technical matters in simple terms
* You will have strong time management and prioritisation skills. There will be lots of balls to juggle in this role
* You will be someone who thrives working in a high speed environment
* You will be excited about working as part of a small, tight-knit team
* Digitally proficient, you will be excited to build an excellent understanding of how to best use Chaser as a product. Curiosity about how and why our product works will serve you well in this role
* Any sales, success or account management experience, along with any experience of working in SaaS, with accounting firms or in credit control is a bonus

*Benefits*

* Competitive salary
* Share options
* Company pension scheme
* 25 days holiday
* Flexible working hours

*How to apply*

In applying please answer the following questions:

# Why have you applied for this role? (Max 100 words)
# What is your proudest achievement and why? ( Max 200 words)
# What is a company or product that you think has excellent educational resources and/or support materials; and what makes them so good?
# Are you eligible to work in the UK?

items.content:
Technical Coach


Thinkful


Technical Coach (Design) 
Remote · Part Time or Full Time


Founded in 2012, Bloc was the first online coding bootcamp. Today, Bloc offers aspiring career-changers programs in software development and design. Bloc offers you an opportunity to join a tight-knit team pursuing a worthy goal: the training, guidance, and support of those who are working towards to new careers as developers and designers. Job Description 
Bloc’s mission is to help individuals pursue their craft and improve their lives. As a Technical Coach at Bloc, you will directly help students develop mastery and support them on their journey to become software developers and designers by helping them solve their day-to-day problems and questions. Responsibilities


* Respond to technical questions and guidance requests that come to the Technical Coaching team

* Adhere to the established Service-Level Agreement to ensure students are receiving responses in the defined timely manner

* Maintain the required quality in assisting students with technical questions and guidance

* Adhere to processes implement by the Technical Coaching team 

* Provide strategic feedback to the Technical Coaching Lead to improve the experience for students and optimize the processes of the team

* Ensure communication with students and others always exemplifies Bloc’s core values

* As necessary, work with Grading Team Lead and other Grading Team Members

* As necessary, interact with mentors, Student Success, or students ad-hoc




Requirements


* Must have at least 6 months of professional industry experience OR have completed one of Bloc’s Developer Track programs OR have completed Bloc's Design Track Program successfully

* Must have significant industry-level experience with: front-end web technologies (HTML/CSS/Javascript/Git) and UX/UI Design or User Research using one of the following tools: Sketch, InVision, Figma 

* Strong written communication skills

* Patient and empathetic

* High level of detail orientation and an exceptional work ethic 

* Must thrive working autonomously 

* Genuinely excited about helping students who are taking charge of their own education and striving for better careers

* Developed sense of empathy and understanding (Learning can be a challenge!)

* Must be coachable and adaptable to a fast-paced work environment

* Must have a reliable, high-speed Internet connection

* Eligible to work in the United States (Bloc does not currently sponsor visas)

* Must reside in one of the following states: Alabama, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, New Hampshire, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Washington, Wisconsin






Terms of Employment


* This role will last for a period of 3 months; continuation depends on performance and mutual interest.

* Remote .

* Flexible full-time or part-time roles available, with the option to work evenings and weekends when Bloc students are active.  10 hours per week minimum.

* Full-time roles are eligible for medical, dental, and vision benefits.


See more jobs at Thinkful

* Adhere to processes implement by the Technical Coaching team 

* Provide strategic feedback to the Technical Coaching Lead to improve the experience for students and optimize the processes of the team

* Ensure communication with students and others always exemplifies Bloc’s core values

* As necessary, work with Grading Team Lead and other Grading Team Members

* As necessary, interact with mentors, Student Success, or students ad-hoc




Requirements


* Must have at least 6 months of professional industry experience OR have completed one of Bloc’s Developer Track programs OR have completed Bloc's Design Track Program successfully

* (Developer Track Technical Coaches) Must have significant industry-level experience with at least 3 of the following: HTML/CSS/Javascript/Git, Node, React, Rails, AngularJS, Open Source Contributions, Databases/SQL/Algorithms/Data Structures

* (Design Track Technical Coaches) Must have significant industry-level experience with: front-end web technologies (HTML/CSS/Javascript/Git) and UX/UI Design or User Research using one of the following tools: Sketch, InVision, Figma 

* Strong written communication skills

* Patient and empathetic

* High level of detail orientation and an exceptional work ethic 

* Must thrive working autonomously 

* Genuinely excited about helping students who are taking charge of their own education and striving for better careers

* Developed sense of empathy and understanding (Learning can be a challenge!)

* Must be coachable and adaptable to a fast-paced work environment

* Must have a reliable, high-speed Internet connection

* Eligible to work in the United States (Bloc does not currently sponsor visas)

* Must reside in one of the following states: Alabama, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, New Hampshire, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Washington, Wisconsin




Terms of Employment


* This role will last for a period of 3 months; continuation depends on performance and mutual interest.

* Remote .

* Flexible full-time or part-time roles available, with the option to work evenings and weekends when Bloc students are active.  10 hours per week minimum.

* Full-time roles are eligible for medical, dental, and vision benefits.


See more jobs at Thinkful

items.title: Client Success Manager
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
We’re looking for someone who’s experienced at managing relationships to join our team and play a crucial (and exciting) role helping our customers make the most of our technology and approach. Whilst you will have the opportunity to work from home, this role will involve working at customer sites, the vast majority of which are in Central London.

*Your role will involve:*

* A bit of consulting;
* A bit of customer support;
* A bit of detective work; and
* Plenty of opportunity to exercise your strategic and creative sides, as you may be planning and producing short videos and writing copy in order to build digital resources.

If you’re not familiar with what digital resources are then don’t worry. What’s more important to us is that you have some experience dealing with (or working in) large-ish companies, you are great at managing relationships, and that you have a bit of a flair for producing written content.

*What we do:*
It seems quite grand but we really do transform the way that business people work, learn and grow as professionals, with Looop’s innovative Digital Learning Platform and methodology. And we do this working with some of the most progressive and well-known companies in the world.

*Who we are:*
Looop is a post-revenue, high-growth technology start-up, which means (in real language) we've done the really hard bit, turning a great idea into a business, and now we're growing the team to build on our initial success!

Since 2014, we've been challenging the Learning & Development (L&D) industry to catch up with the way that technology enhances our daily lives: to ditch rubbish e-learning and keep out of the training room! By doing this, L&D can help everybody be better at their jobs and take on exciting new roles.

Our customers are not just companies who pay us in exchange for tech. We build deep relationships with the brilliant people at ASOS, Amazon, Sky, Financial Times, and more, and they rely on us for thought-leading, practical support to get better results through their Learning & Development.

As people, we are experts at what we do, driven to make a difference, and friends who like working with each other. We challenge and support each other to be the best we can be and celebrate the many successes we have along the way.

*The exciting new role in our team:*
Our customers have come to rely on our expertise and responsiveness and we are looking for someone to help them with this. So, we're looking for somebody to join us who wants to:

Help the brilliant and ambitious people, that we’re fortunate enough to call our customers, to do what they want to do with Looop… but better. You'll do this by responding to - and anticipating - their needs and staying close to them, leading them on their way, and providing expert, hands-on support;

Help deliver consulting services to our customers following our proven (and improving) Looop methodology, which will include:

* Helping them unpack business performance problems using the Looop methodology
* Designing and building resources
* Designing and leading campaigns for engagement
* Helping to quantify and report successful campaigns;
* Continuously improve Looop’s customer onboarding - and subsequent experiences - so their entire organisation benefits from what we know they can achieve with us.

*Experience:*
We are really pushing our customers to think differently about their L&D and their business, and - in so doing - we’re helping them to improve. For this reason, we need somebody with at least some experience of working in a corporate environment.

Developing ‘content’ is also a core element of this role, which will mean designing and building of learning resources as well as gaining high user-engagement, with the skills for this including writing, basic video production and running marketing campaigns.

*You are:*
Real customer success comes from the heart. You believe in what you do and are passionate about engaging people and driving positive change in business through the use of innovative technology. If this is you, we’d love you to speak with you!

Many of the world’s most exciting and progressive companies are transforming their Learning & Development by adopting our technology and our approach, and we would love your help in taking care of them.

*If you sound like the right person for this role then please apply below.*

items.content:
Citus Data | Support Engineer | Remote friendly, Eastern/Central US timezone | https://www.citusdata.com/jobs

Citus is worry-free Postgres for SaaS. Made to scale out, Citus is an extension to Postgres that distributes queries across any number of servers. Whether you have a multi-tenant app that needs scale, or you need to deliver real-time analytics to customers, with Citus you can focus on your app—not your database.

At Citus Data, we make it simple to shard Postgres. Citus is available as open source, as on-prem software, and as a fully-managed database service on AWS.

You can learn more detail on the role at https://www.citusdata.com/jobs/supportengineer

Or apply at imagine@citusdata.com

items.content:
Phusion (Passenger) | Customer Success Manager (Sales / Account Manager) | Amsterdam or Remote | Full-time

Over 650.000 websites worldwide use Phusion Passenger to improve web app performance, boost productivity, and maximize security. As a Customer Success Manager your focus is creating and maintaining friendly relationships with our customers around the globe.

Tasks include maintaining account information, collecting customer references, testimonials and case studies, documenting and implementing procedures and organising referral / affiliate programs and retention campaigns. You’ll work closely together with engineering and DevRel in tackling customer challenges.

The ideal candidate has working experience providing customer support, has excellent written and verbal business communication skills (English), an a keen eye for detail.

Phusion covers lunch, drinks and snacks when you’re in the office, offers flexible work hours, travel allowance for day-to-day and conference travel, the best hardware and a relaxed and fun company culture.

For more info: https://www.phusion.nl/careers | apply directly: jobs@phusion.nl | read more: https://blog.phusion.nl/2018/06/18/happy-birthday-phusion/
